[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Interview/317_test.gif[/img][/align]

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774]Bandors[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Hello! Thank you very much for participating in my interview for edition #317. Before we start, are there any shoutouts you'd like to do?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774][color=white][b]Bandors:[/b][/color][/url] There's so many people but I'm going to limit it to my buddy Bane who really got a tattoo of my group's logo on his arm.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] That's quite the showcase of loyalty - speaking of your group, how has ownership been treating you? Do you have any thoughts on the current state of HF groups?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774][color=white][b]Bandors:[/b][/color][/url] Well, right now I kind of think the market is in a panic. The deletion of SST will have heavy effects on the market- where most group owners earn their profits. Even I lost out on a bunch of money when my SST threads were deleted. I think that the market will bounce back though, and wealth of customers will be redistributed through other products / services. From a social point, groups are still the place to be to make new friends quick, and I don't think that will change for a while. Ownership has been an interesting experience, but I've basically ran other groups for years so I'm not really experiencing anything new.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Does Illuminati have any plans to combat that with upcoming group products/services, or any other surprises?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774][color=white][b]Bandors:[/b][/color][/url] Yeah, we have a lot of projects in the woodworks. A couple have been scrapped, and the illuminati booter was just scrapped due to new rules, but we will rebound soon. I'm confident that illuminati will still be a top market force on HF. For example, later this week I'll be launching a student program. One on one lessons with members teaching them how to make stacks.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] What kind of people will be associated with the new student program you speak of, behind the scenes? Many have mentioned how well connected you are in the hacking and pentesting community.
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774][color=white][b]Bandors:[/b][/url] I'm looking to expand what I teach. Right now, I just offer hacking lessons through my site HackerTeacher.com but I am to begin teaching money making lessons through the illuminati student program. I'm not sure of all the details yet, so keep a look out for my sticky in the groups section when it finally comes out. It's going to be just me running the ship for now. The people who I do jobs for are far to wealthy to want to bother with HF things lol.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity[/b][/color][/url] What sort of money making techniques can members expect? Without you giving it away of course. Will a lot of previous experience be required?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774[color=white][b]Bandors:[/b][/color][/url] Well, I know so many different money making methods that don't require any background knowledge. I'm sure there's a lot of people willing to pay for a few lessons to learn to make some extra scratch online. I'm considering having it be a cheap price, but university style group lectures instead of one on one learning which I do with hackerteacher.com

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] So instead of the traditional route where people pay for a method and are left to learn it themselves, you're not only offering a group spot where people can work and collaborate in a likeminded setting, but are also offering your personal expertise?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774][color=white][b]Bandors:[/b][/url] Yes! Instead of an eBook, I am going to be really talking to the members during sessions, giving tips, methods, personalized methods to make money. Not everyone likes every method, so I'm trying to switch things up.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] And then at the end of the day even if they choose to put in no effort they still get to be apart of the group. It sounds like quite a lucrative opportunity. Do you have a price tag in mind you're going to be charging, or will you be choosing select members on a application basis?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774][color=white][b]Bandors:[/b][/color][/url] That's still something I need to figure out. I just want to help as many people as possible become internet money making gods like me. I'm going to try and keep the price as low as possible to include as many people as I can. I'm trying to build a community here. Check the stickied threads in the group tab within a week or so and I should have all the details squared away by then. I'm thinking I could also incorporate hacking lessons, everything isn't 100%, just a rough idea of what I want to do.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Aside from your group do you have any personal projects or endeavors currently in the works? I also saw recently the huge win you made on bustabit, were you expecting to walk away with so much?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774][color=white][b]Bandors:[/b][/color][/url] Hahaha no way I expected to win. It didn't feel real for a couple days. I kind of feel bad that I'm the one who had the big win. I'm not exactly the most deserving, I already have a stable income. I ended up blowing five thousand dollars with my girlfriend in the most crazy party month of my life in las Vegas. I even met Omni, and took him out for dinner and drinks. I spent another chunk on my group and I threw the rest into my hedge fund. Aside from the group, I'm trying to start up some big charity things to help the homeless. Handing out food, socks, books. I'm looking to expand this when I head over to Asia. I'm hoping I can help hundreds of people over there for cheap.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] That's really humble of you - and what made you want to move to Asia?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774][color=white][b]Bandors:[/b][/color][/url] I've just spent so long in America. Growing up, I moved around a lot. I've spent a lot of time in all corners of America. I don't think there's much more I can learn from staying here. I work online, so I'm planning on just walking the earth with my girlfriend. I'm planning on starting with Asia just because of how crazy it will be. If I moved to Europe, I imaging things would not be much different. Africa is too under developed, so is south America. So, I am choosing Asia to start with.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Not to mention you also get to escape the reign of trump, which is a good thing. Thanks so much though for the informative responses, I'm sure a lot of people will be interested in your upcoming program. Before I end the interview, are there any final words you'd like to leave us with? Any final shoutouts?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774[color=white][b]Bandors:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks for interviewing me! 

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/WorldNews.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Donald Trump Elected President of the United States[/color][/b]
After a heated political season, Donald J. Trump defeated Hillary Clinton to become the 45th president of the United States. The victory was declared an upset as polls throughout the season generally showed Democratic-nominee Hillary Clinton with a strong lead. Trump will be the first president without any prior government or military experience. Trump ran on a platform that embodied the repudiation of the current political establishment, and that message largely resonated among blue-collar voters. In this race, Trump lost the popular vote but won the electoral college. In his victory speech, Trump said: “Now it’s time for America to bind the wounds of division. It is time for us to come together as one united people. It’s time.” Trump will take office on January 20, 2017. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/09/us/politics/hillary-clinton-donald-trump-president.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Vigilantism on the Rise in Mexico[/color][/b]
Citizens upset with the crime in Mexico are performing unsanctioned acts of retribution upon its criminals. In a recent case, four assailants were shot dead by an unidentified “justiciero” after the assailants attempted to rob commuters on a bus. Police are in pursuit of those that commit acts of vigilantism, but the public has done little to assist in the capture of these perceived heroes. In fact, many on social media have shown praise and support for vigilantes. An estimated 98% of crimes that take place in Mexico go unpunished, and 93% are not even reported. Current surveys show that 46% of Mexicans approve of vigilante acts, and 80% approve of "harsher punishments" to deter crime.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/nov/11/mexico-vigilantes-killings-public-support] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Taiwan to be First Country in Asia to Legalize Gay Marriage[/color][/b]
Three bills in support of marriage equality are currently being made by Taiwanese lawmakers, and one of those bills is expected to pass within months. Both lawmakers and President Tsai Ing-wen, Taiwan’s first female head of state, have shown prominent support for same-sex marriage. Surveys show that approval of gay marriage is at 80% among those between ages 20 and 29, and the majority of Taiwan has shown support for gay marriage. Taiwan’s prominent religions, including Buddhism, take no strong position on sexual orientation, and that is part of the reason there is not much opposition to the movement. Yu Mei-nu, a ruling Democratic Progressive Party lawmaker, said this move towards legalization is “a big step forward for the history of human rights.”[i][size=x-small][url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/e9c5b9c82abe4bc987f820aa104f2893] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]    [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/5EHiJAb.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[color=white][url=http://fortune.com/2016/11/11/black-friday-2016-tech-deals/][b]Deals to Look Forward to on Black Friday[/b][/url][/color]
Black Friday is right around the corner, and in anticipation of the big shopping day, some of the most prominent American retailers are already promoting some sales. On November 25, the American population will wake to the thrill of Black Friday sales. Everything will be up for grabs and various tech devices are at the top of various priority lists. And as a company with some of the most expensive yet sought after products, Apple deals are being dangerously eyed — whether for the iPhone 7, iPhone 7 Plus or the MacBook Air. Not to be outdone, Samsung is also offering discounts on a wide array of products including the Galaxy S7 and S7 Edge, and many of their top of the line smart TVs.

[color=white][url=http://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-com-ftc-idUSKBN13602Y][b]Amazon Ordered to Refund In-App Purchases Made by Children[/b][/url][/color]
A federal judge laid out rules Thursday for how Amazon.com Inc. must refund the parents of children who made in-app purchases on Kindle and Android devices without their consent between 2011 and 2014. The FTC in July 2014 accused Amazon of making it too easy for children to run up bills while playing games such as "Pet Shop Story" and "Ice Age Village" on mobile devices, resulting in an estimated $86 million of unauthorized charges. U.S. District Judge John Coughenour, in Amazon's hometown of Seattle, issued his order more than six months after finding the online retailer liable, in a case brought by the Federal Trade Commission. Thursday's order calls for Amazon to set up a notice-and-claims process beginning in early 2017 to alert parents of their eligibility for refunds, and then to reimburse them.

[color=white][url=http://www.theverge.com/2016/11/10/13588396/gopro-karma-drone-recall-defect-shut-off-falling-video][b]GoPro Karma Recalled After Just 18 Days on the Market[/b][/url][/color]
GoPro’s stock has been dropping like a rock — and so have the company’s new Karma drones. The company, which has seen its stock slide and sales tumble, is recalling the 2,500 units sold of the new Karma drone, which was introduced just a few weeks ago to positive reviews. This is the product GoPro had put much of its hopes for in the fourth quarter on advancing sales again. GoPro said a "very small number" of units had lost power during operation, so it was recalling all of them to fix the issue. Owners of Karma can return their units to GoPro, or their place of purchase, for a full refund. Replacement units are not being offered. GoPro plans to resume shipment of Karma as soon as the issue is resolved. 
[/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Mass Effect: Andromeda Announced![/color][/b]
The internet is being flooded with details since BioWare announced Mass Effect: Andromea. The December issue of Game Informer contains a huge feature on the upcoming game. Interesting new features like crafting and New Game+ mode are discussed and it is also mentioned that the overall story will be different than any of the previous titles. In regards to crafting, players will be able to acquire blueprints throughout the game to build weapons and armor. Fans should recall the original Mass Effect having minimal mods, but Andromeda sounds like it really pushes the envelop with extensive modding. "The narrative setting means that you have alien races with new tech, and I think it's compelling for players to craft new stuff," producer Fabrice Condominas said. "That's part of the roots of the RPG system." Andromeda's New Game+ will also allow you to change your gender. That option wasn't available in Mass Effect 3. BioWare also discussed multiplayer at some detail. There will be a "prestige" mechanism that encourages players to try different characters. Also, Andromeda's multiplayer takes place within the campaign's fiction. You play as a member of the Apex Force, tasked with defending against waves of increasingly difficult-to-defeat alien invaders alongside your squadmates. That's the same setup as Mass Effect 3's multiplayer, which was well-received, Frazier said, so BioWare used it as the core for Andromeda. Andromeda is scheduled to launch this spring for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC. More gameplay footage will be shown during The Game Awards in early December.  [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/mass-effect-andromeda-has-crafting-updated-new-gam/1100-6445237/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]GameStop's Black Friday Deals Revealed![/color][/b]
Another store's Black Friday ad has been discovered and this time it's GameStop's! The 12-page ad has been published online by BFAds. On the console side, you can get the PS4's 500 GB Uncharted 4 bundle for $250--and for Friday only, you'll receive a free copy of either The Last of Us Remastered or Ratchet & Clank. $50 is also being taken off all Xbox One systems, letting you pick up, for example, the 500 GB Gears of War 4 Xbox One S blue bundle for $250. The store will also be among those where you can get a $100 New 3DS. Other deals of note include Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare's Legacy Edition for $60, Overwatch for $35, The Witcher 3: Complete Edition for $30, Gears of War 4 for $35, and Far Cry Primal for $25. PS4 controllers are marked down to $45, while Xbox One controllers will go for $50. The stylish Gears of War 4 special edition JD Xbox One controller is also down to $55. Not all of these deals are as good as the prices you'll find elsewhere: PS4 and Xbox One controllers will be $39 at Walmart, for example. We suggest keeping an open eye for other deals as weeks progress because there are bound to be plenty. Luckily, most deals leak in advance so you will have time to plan your shopping accordingly! [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.bfads.net/stores/gamestop/ads/black-friday/page-1#] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]PS4 Pro Review Roundup![/color][/b]
The PS4 hit shelves last weekend and critics have delivered their verdicts on the more powerful console. The PS4 Pro offers the ability for games to have better performance and display at 4K. Some games may run natively at 3840x2160, while others may checkerboard or scale up to it. And despite its ability to display at the resolution, it lacks a 4K Blu-ray drive. A collection of some noteworthy reviews can be found within the at the source of this article. The general consensus is that the PS4 is an amazing system, but it isn't worth dishing out cash for if you already have a PS4. There simply isn't anything special about it to make PS4 owners seek it out unless they're having trouble with their original system. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/ps4-pro-review-roundup/1100-6445256/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/11/15/politics/donald-trump-trade-memo-transition/index.html][color=#FFFFFF]Trump wins Presidency[/color][/url]
[/b]President-elect Donald Trump is set to take over the White House. Trump has made his 200 day plan public to the citizens of the United States. When Trump takes office, he has noted that he will be reforming America’s trade policy altogether. He believes the current trade policy is both out of whack and unstable. One of Trump’s promises while running for POTUS was that he was going to wipe out the North American Free Trade Agreement. NAFTA is nothing short of a trade bloc that was signed by the U.S., Canada, and Mexico. The memo that has been brought to light by Trump and company goes on to detail a plethora of promises that were made during his campaign. As reported by CNN, "The Trump trade plan breaks with the globalist wings of both the Republican and Democratic parties," the document notes. "The Trump administration will reverse decades of conciliatory trade policy. New trade agreements will be negotiated that provide for the interests of US workers and companies first." Furthermore, Trump plans to redraft NAFTA, halt the current Trans-Pacific Partnership deal, revisit imports, zero in on trade practices that are a threat to the country, and dig deeper into trade deals. 

[b][url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/11/15/health/sandy-hook-families-appeal-to-connecticut-supreme-court/index.html][color=#FFFFFF]Sandy Hook Versus Gun Makers[/color][/url]
[/b]In 2012, there was a total of nine victims that stepped forward after the Sandy Hook massacre. These victims went on to file a colossal lawsuit against gun makers whose weapons were used in the massacre carried out by Adam Lanza. In 2012, 20-year old Lanza went on to kill dozens of children and a total of six teachers. In his assault, Lanza used a Bushmaster AR-15 that reigned down terror on those who occupied the school. CNN noted "In their appeal, attorneys for the families describe the shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School as "a singular event in Connecticut history" that was carried out by a man with a weapon "designed for our armed forces and engineered to deliver maximum carnage." They argue Remington is responsible since the company "chose to sell a weapon of war and aggressively market its assaultive capabilities." The families of the victims are holding their ground firm and plan to remain persistent until the end. The victim’s families believe that Remington should be held solely responsible for the carnage that took place back in 2012. As mentioned prior, the involved families think Remington has no reason at all whatsoever to offer a war-style assault rifle to people of the public. Gun control has been a central topic of discussion for some time now and will remain that way for years to come as massacres such as Sandy Hook continue to unfold.


[b][url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/11/15/politics/mexico-plans-for-trump-deportations/index.html][color=#FFFFFF]Mexico Prepares for Trump[/color][/url]
[/b]With President-Elect Donald Trump taking office in the new year, Mexico has begun drafting up possible plans that will help fight against the mass deportations. As Trump made clear throughout his entire campaign, he plans to deport thousands of illegal immigrants. Apart of his 200-day agenda, Trump highlighted the fact that he was going to go after illegals in the country that held criminal records first. After removing those with criminal records, he plans to go after those who are in gangs. Once he has deported all criminals and gang members, Trump promised to focus on those who are blending in. He has repeatedly noted that all illegals will be removed from the country at one point or another. CNN reported that "Foreign Minister Claudia Ruiz is coordinating the efforts, he added, and plans to have a series of measures ready should the deportations begin." A plethora of government leaders in Mexico have added the possibility of mass deportation to the top of their agendas. It has become a major headache for leaders in the country. Also reported by CNN, "During a CBS "60 Minutes" interview on Sunday, Trump said he would look to deport, or incarcerate, up to 3 million illegal immigrants." Trump’s plan is to deport millions and all the while doing so, build a border wall that keeps all illegals out permanently.

[color=transparent]         [/color]
